clinical_study.brief_title: Repetitive Position Change Improves MCE Image Quality
clinical_study.official_title: Repetitive Position Change After Dimethicone Improves Gastric Image Quality for Magnetically Controlled Capsule Endoscopy: a Prospective, Single-blinded, Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: By comparing dimethicone administration with/without subsequent repetitive position change before magnetically controlled capsule endoscopy (MCE) examination, the investigators aim to determine the efficacy of repetitive position change in improving image quality for gastric preparation in patients receiving MCE examination.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, single-blinded, randomized controlled trial. Subjects receiving magnetically controlled capsule endoscopy at the institution will be randomly allocated into intervention group and control group before the procedure. Right after ingesting 5 g dimethicone mixed with 100 ml water, subjects in the control group will receive no intervention; while subjects in the intervention group will be instructed to repeatedly change the body position according to a prespecified protocol for a period of 15 min. Thirty and 40 min after dimethicone administration, subjects in both groups will additionally take 200 ml and 800 ml water, respectively, and undergo MCE examination. Image quality will be rated by two physicians independently.

primary_outcome.description: The image cleanliness of gastric cavity of six primary anatomical landmarks of stomach (cardia, fundus, body, angulus, antrum, and pylorus) were recorded for evaluation. A 4-point grading scale was introduced to define the cleanliness as excellent (no adherent mucus and foam: score 4), good (mild mucus and foam but does not obscure vision: score 3), fair (considerable amount of mucus or foam present precluding a completely reliable examination: score 2) and poor (large amount of mucus or foam residue needing water to clear it: score 1)

The mucosal visualization introduced as good (>90% of the mucosa observed: score 3), fair (70-90% of the mucosa observed: score 2) and poor (<70% of the mucosa observed: score 1) as used in the investigator's previous study.

secondary_outcome.description: Positive lesions defined as the pathology detected by MCE including superficial gastritis, chronic erosive gastritis, polyps and ulcers

Safety of MCE, or adverse events, defined as symptoms or signs such as abdominal distention, nausea, or vomiting, were monitored closely during the MCE procedure. Capsule retention (i.e., a capsule endoscope remaining in the gastrointestinal tract for more than two weeks or a capsule endoscope that requires directed intervention or therapy to aid its expulsion) was monitored and followed up for up to two weeks.

arm_group.description: Right after ingesting 5 g dimethicone mixed with 100 ml water, subjects in the control group will receive no intervention. Thirty and 40 min after dimethicone administration, subjects in both groups will additionally take 200 ml and 800 ml water, respectively, and undergo MCE examination.

Right after ingesting 5 g dimethicone mixed with 100 ml water, subjects in the intervention group will be instructed to repeatedly change the body position according to a prespecified protocol (in the order of the left lateral position to prone, left lateral, supine, right lateral, and repeat last four positions twice, each for 1 min) for a period of 15 min. Thirty and 40 min after dimethicone administration, subjects in both groups will additionally take 200 ml and 800 ml water, respectively, and undergo MCE examination.

intervention.description: Right after ingesting 5 g dimethicone mixed with 100 ml water, subjects in the intervention group will be instructed to repeatedly change the body position according to a prespecified protocol (in the order of the left lateral position to prone, left lateral, supine, right lateral, and repeat last four positions twice, each for 1 min) for a period of 15 min. Thirty and 40 min after dimethicone administration, subjects in both groups will additionally take 200 ml and 800 ml water, respectively, and undergo MCE examination.
